Dear Dr. Jeana Koerber:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
1/3/2023. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Kari Muntean, the area manager at (734) 395-0920.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was 1 incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan related to the
maltreatment during this licensing period. This incident was investigated in special
investigation 2022C0214024 dated 7/29/2022. The original allegation involved a
youth suffering a broken arm and claiming it occurred when pushed to the ground by
a staff. Upon the investigation, it was discovered the staff had supervision of this
youth and had engaged in disciplining the youth rather than using appropriate
behavior management techniques. Additional findings were uncovered when it was
learned two staff were not following facility policy when they failed to follow the safety
separation procedure, report a relationship between them, and used their personal
phones while supervising youth. The findings resulted in the facility providing an
approved corrective action plan (CAP) on 8/24/2022.
AND
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans.
The findings of Special Investigation 2022C0214009 resulted in the facility providing
an approved corrective action plan (CAP) on 8/24/2022. The facility began to retrain
all staff on appropriate (DCWL approved) behavior management techniques (Safety
Care) and will have staff review these techniques monthly during staff meetings.
Formal trainings of these behavior management techniques (Safety Care) will occur
bi-annually. The staff involved in the incident has been terminated and will be marked
as not to rehire.
The only other CAP required during this reporting period was in regard to the interim
licensing inspection dated 2/10/2022. There were three citations involving the
following. No documentation of a Tuberculosis screening being completed for two
personnel files, no documentation of one staff completing initial orientation, and two
updated treatment plans not completed within 90-days. None of these issues were
discovered during this inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
2

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
